leftInformation.aboutRus: Twelve years ago, a family of doctors decided to build a homestead in a village 10 kilometers from Volkovysk, where only nine people live. Today, the 'U Rysya' farmstead is a complex consisting of five houses.
leftInformation.aboutNeoman: 134 km along the highway Minsk-Grodno. wooden house with a Russian stove, steam room, terrace, swimming pool, barbecue. Organization of excursions around the Golden Ring of Ivye region. Fishing (pike, crucian carp, tench, roach).
leftInformation.aboutDybrava: Grodno region, Novogrudok district, Olkhovka village. Cozy living room with fireplace and access to the terrace, TV, kitchen, four bedrooms.
leftInformation.aboutBybliki: Grodno region, Ivye district, village Sheluti. You will be pleasantly surprised by the fast-flowing Gavya River, one of the cleanest rivers in Belarus, which flows a couple of meters from the estate.

rightInformation.aboutNews: For users of our website, a DISCOUNT of 15% is provided for booking estates when using a special PROMO CODE:

grodno.textAll: The territory of Grodno was inhabited by people from the Late Paleolithic period. The oldest settlements were located near Lake Svityazh, near the village of Cheresha in Novogrudok, Nesilovichi in Dyatlovo, Zblyany in Lida districts, and near the mouth of the Kotra River. Eastern Slavic tribes (Dregovichs, Krivichs, Volhynians, Drevlyans), Western Slavic (Mozovshans), Eastern Baltic (Lithuanians), and Western Baltic (Yatvingians) lived here. The Slavic colonization began in the second half of the 1st millennium.
grodno.textAll1: The principalities, like other Western Russian lands, were under constant threat of Mongol-Tatar conquest for a long time. For over two centuries, they served as a frontline in the struggle against the aggression of the Crusaders. In the midst of the fight against the Crusaders' aggression, the famous Union of Krewo was concluded in the Kreva Castle, located in the Smorgon district, in 1385. This union marked the beginning of the unification of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania and Poland. A significant milestone in the joint struggle for independence against external aggression was the Battle of Grunwald in 1410. The Grodno, Volkovysk, Lida, and other regiments fought alongside Belarusian, Russian, and Polish forces, achieving a brilliant victory over the conquerors.
grodno.textAll2: In the 12th to 16th centuries, the largest cities and towns in the Grodno region began to play a significant role in the economic and cultural life of the country. Some of them, such as Grodno, Novogrudok, Slonim, and others, gained self-governance in accordance with the Magdeburg Law. The economy of Grodno, as an administrative and territorial unit, was one of the most developed and prosperous in the country at that time. After the Second and Third Partitions of the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth in 1793 and 1795, the territory of the modern Grodno region became part of the Russian Empire.
grodno.textAll3: As the Slavs settled in the territories of Grodno, they gradually assimilated the ancient Baltic-speaking population that lived there. The assimilation of the Balts continued until the 12th-13th centuries. In the 12th to the first half of the 14th century, there existed the principalities of Grodno, Novogrudok, and Volkovysk. These independent state formations bore the imprint of the unified political and socio-economic development of the East Slavic lands within the framework of Kievan Rus - the cradle of the fraternal Belarusian, Russian, and Ukrainian peoples.
grodno.textAll4: A significant event in its history was the formation of the Grodno Governorate in 1801, which soon became one of the most economically developed governorates of Russia. By 1890, Grodno alone had over 70 factories and plants employing more than 2,000 workers. The tobacco factory in Grodno was one of the largest industrial enterprises in Belarus. The woodworking industry flourished in Slonim, while Dyatlovo specialized in hosiery production, and Smorgon and Oshmyany had a thriving leather industry. According to the conditions of the Riga Peace Treaty in 1921, the lands of Grodno were ceded to Poland. In September 1939, Grodno became part of the Belarusian Soviet Socialist Republic (BSSR).
grodno.textAll5: During the years 1939-1941, Grodno saw the opening of shoe, sewing, and furniture factories, a bread plant, a teacher training institute, a Polish theater, as well as the establishment of historical and regional archives. During the Great Patriotic War (1941-1945), the partisan movement experienced significant development in the region. Thousands of people from Grodno bravely fought on the front lines of the war. The fascist invaders destroyed over 120 industrial enterprises, almost all collective farms, state farms, and machine-tractor stations (MTS) in the area. On September 20, 1944, the Grodno Oblast was established with its center in Grodno.

farmsteads.title: Folwark "U Ry≈õka"
farmsteads.text: Ten kilometers away from Volkovysk, in a village inhabited by only nine people, five years ago a family of medical professionals decided to build a manor.
farmsteads.textAll: Ten kilometers away from Volkovysk, in a village inhabited by only nine people, five years ago a family of medical professionals decided to build a manor. Today, the folwark "U Ry≈õka" is a complex consisting of five cottages and six hectares of water area. The place is remarkable because everything, from the carvings on the chairs to the potter's cottage, was created by the efforts of one family. The manor "U Ry≈õka" was meant to grow. There was enough territory near the village of Korevichi. The folwark is designed for active tourists. The hosts set themselves the goal of surprising and entertaining tourists. That is why each cottage has a special feature. The project "Sustainable Development at the Local Level" by the European Union, in which Janina participated and won a grant. After a year and a half, wooden cottages for a carver, weaver, and potter were built. The carver's cottage has a Russian stove. It is on this stove that the national dish of Belarusians, Poles, and Lithuanians - a wooden pie, is cooked.
farmsteads.titleVideo: Where to Rest in Belarus - "Folwark "U Ry≈õka"

farmsteads.title: Agro Homestead "Near the Neman River"
farmsteads.text: 134 km along the Minsk-Grodno highway. A wooden house with a Russian stove, sauna, terrace, pool, barbecue area. Organization of excursions around the Golden Ring of the Ivye region. Fishing (pike, carp, tench, roach).
farmsteads.textAll: The "Near the Neman River" homestead is located 10 kilometers from the Belarusian town of Ivye in the "Razdory" reserve in the Grodno region. It is a real Belarusian village with traditional houses and way of life! Next to the village, there are coniferous forests and wide meadows. Picturesque landscapes and churches located near the estate have a calming effect. The beautiful rural houses make you want to visit them. And despite the peaceful way of life, there is always something to do in the village - you will definitely not be bored here! Sometimes city dwellers are interested in simply admiring the local landscapes and village houses, which have been standing for 60 years. All the yards in the village are well-maintained, immersed in greenery and flowers. The beauty of the village where the homestead is located is that all the pictures of a happy life are real, created with hard work and love for the environment.

farmsteads.title: Agro-homestead "Dubrava"
farmsteads.text: Grodno region, Novogrudok district, Olkhovka village. Cozy living room with a fireplace and access to the terrace, TV, kitchen, four bedrooms.
farmsteads.textAll: If you are tired of the hustle and bustle of everyday life, the noise of the city, unresolved problems, and excessive burdens, then leave it all behind for a while. The "Dubrava" agro-homestead, located 160 km from Minsk in the village of Olkhovka, Novogrudok district, invites you to immerse yourself in silence, listen to the sounds of nature, become a part of this surrounding beauty, and finally, not to rush anywhere. The "Dubrava" homestead is a place where the soul rests! The "Dubrava" homestead is a fenced area that houses a modern wooden attic-style house with a terrace and all amenities. The house can accommodate up to 11 people overnight. It features a cozy living room with a fireplace, a fully equipped kitchen, 4 bedrooms with single and double beds, 2 bathrooms, a bathtub, a washing machine, and a television.

farmsteads.title: Agro Guesthouse "Bubliki"
farmsteads.text: Grodno Region, Ivye District, village of Sheluti. You will be pleasantly surprised by the fast-flowing river Gavia, one of the cleanest rivers in Belarus, which flows just a few meters from the guesthouse's territory.
farmsteads.textAll: The "Bubliki" agro guesthouse is located in the Ivye District of the Grodno Region. The guesthouse features a spacious banquet hall for 50 people, where you can hold festive events. There is also a covered gazebo for up to 40 people for celebrations.In the house of the "Bubliki" guesthouse, a group of up to 10 people can be accommodated. It is equipped with all necessary amenities: furniture and appliances. On the guesthouse's territory, there is a stove-grill where you can cook shish kebabs and fish soup. There is also a parking lot available.

farmsteads.title: Agro Guesthouse "Forest Eden"
farmsteads.text: Grodno Region, village of Porechie. Located 30 km from Grodno and 1.5 km from Lithuania, in a secluded picturesque location. Near the house, there is a Russian wood-fired sauna with a sauna, shower, and a barrel for pouring water on the first floor.
farmsteads.textAll: The tourist complex "Forest Eden" is a peaceful corner surrounded by young pine forest, located 30 km from the city of Grodno. If you enjoy nature vacations, tired of the hustle and bustle of the city, or simply passing through Grodno, the guesthouse in the pine forest with a Russian sauna and barbecue areas will be an ideal place to recharge and relax. The guesthouse can accommodate the whole family. There is a playground with a trampoline and slides on the premises, and toys, board games, and books are freely available. Additionally, you can rent air hockey, table tennis, bicycles, jumpers, and a boat for walks on the lake.

farmsteads.title: Agrousadba in Zhirovichi
farmsteads.text: S≈Çonimska Street, Zhirovichi village. Guest house, terraces, fireplace, barbecue grills, sauna, gazebo, sports grounds, children's playground, board games, free Wi-Fi, pond, excursions to Zhirovichi Monastery.
farmsteads.textAll: Zhirovichi is a unique place in Belarus, and the main attraction here is the Miraculous Icon of Zhirovichi Mother of God, beautiful architecture of Zhirovichi Monastery churches, holy springs with healing water, and natural and historical landmarks. The staff can communicate freely in English, Polish, Russian, and Ukrainian. For guests, there is one type of accommodation available - a holiday home.

farmsteads.title: Agrousadba Sonichi
farmsteads.text: Grodno district, village Sonichi 6a. For guests, there is a beautiful table for 30 people, a Russian bathhouse, a swimming pool, bicycles, boats, catamarans, kayaks, a Russian stove, a barbecue grill, a smokehouse.
farmsteads.textAll: Located on the banks of the Augustow Canal, 25 kilometers from Grodno, is the Sonichi agrousadba. The guest house is made of natural wood combined with hand-forged elements. The house offers a living room, two bedrooms, a kitchen, a bathroom, a sauna with a swimming pool, and a shower. The territory of the agrousadba is well-maintained and features an artificial pond, a fountain, a picturesque bridge, and a gazebo where you can use a barbecue grill, smokehouse, and oven. The gazebo is designed for 30 people and is suitable for hosting various festive events. Guests of the agrousadba can enjoy a Russian sauna with a wood-burning stove and a swimming pool.

farmsteads.title: Agrousadba 'Lidski Khutorok'
farmsteads.text: Grodno region, city of Lida. A two-story bathhouse, a veranda with a fireplace stove for barbecues and kebabs. The house has everything necessary for a quality rest.
farmsteads.textAll: The agrousadba 'Lidski Khutorok' is located in the city, but it is hidden from the hustle and bustle of the city under the crowns of tall oaks, limes, and birches. It is more than five hundred meters away from the nearest buildings, so it is a kind of secluded village. The house is a modern construction made of white brick. Everything is thought out to the smallest detail: underfloor heating, an interior that combines elements of antiquity and modernity. Two bedrooms are prepared for guests at the agrousadba. One bedroom has a double bed, and the other has two single beds, a sofa bed, and a stove-bed. The house has a banquet hall with a Russian stove that can accommodate 30 people. This room can be used for celebrations, weddings, as well as a conference hall for conducting seminars. There is a home theater with a large TV and a good sound system. The hall has an exit to the terrace and the kitchen, where the hosts will cook for you. Separate sanitary facilities are provided for guests: a toilet, bidet, shower, and washbasin.

farmsteads.title: Baltic Coast Estate
farmsteads.text: Beregovoy village. Baltic Coast Estate is a sauna complex where you can improve your health and have a great rest.
farmsteads.textAll: The estate offers a sauna with SPA procedures for relaxation. You can rent a cottage with 3 rooms (2 bedrooms and 1 living room), and you will also have a traditional village sauna at your disposal. The host's house has a SPA center, which includes an infrared sauna, a 4-seat SPA pool, a massage chair, a billiard table, a plasma TV, and a grill. The cabin is equipped with a kitchenette with all modern amenities, and the room will impress with its impressive size, where a leather-covered sofa and a huge table made of natural alder wood comfortably accommodate up to 10 people. You can store your belongings in a convenient sliding wardrobe by Komandor. And, of course, there is a large widescreen TV with multiple channels. During cool weather, the fireplace will warm you up and create a cozy atmosphere, and you can sit at the bar with friends.
